SEARCH
Package PlanetSystem

Class PlanetSystem

java.lang.Object
PlanetSystem.PlanetSystem
public class PlanetSystem extends Object
Manages a hierarchical planetary system containing stars, planets, and satellites. Provides functionality to create and modify the system, and generate various reports.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PlanetSystem()
    Creates a new empty planetary system.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addPlanet(String planetName, String parentName, double temperature, double pressure, double humidity, double radiation)
    Adds a new planet to the system under a specified parent.
    void
    addSatellite(String satelliteName, String parentName, double temperature, double pressure, double humidity, double radiation)
    Adds a new satellite (moon) to the system under a specified parent.
    void
    createPlanetSystem(String starName, double temperature, double pressure, double humidity, double radiation)
    Creates a new planetary system with a star as its root.
    void
    findRadiationAnomalies(double threshold)
    Finds all celestial bodies with radiation levels above the specified threshold.
    void
    getPathTo(String targetName)
    Finds and displays the path from the root to a specified celestial body.
    void
    printMissionReport()
    Prints a complete mission report for the entire planetary system.
    void
    printMissionReport(String nodeName)
    Prints a mission report for a specific celestial body.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlanetSystem

      public PlanetSystem()
      Creates a new empty planetary system.

  • Method Details

    • createPlanetSystem

      public void createPlanetSystem(String starName, double temperature, double pressure, double humidity, double radiation)
      Creates a new planetary system with a star as its root.
      Parameters:
      starName - The name of the star
      temperature - The star's temperature in Kelvin
      pressure - The star's pressure in Pascals
      humidity - The star's humidity percentage (must be 0 for stars)
      radiation - The star's radiation level in Sieverts

    • addPlanet

      public void addPlanet(String planetName, String parentName, double temperature, double pressure, double humidity, double radiation)
      Adds a new planet to the system under a specified parent.
      Parameters:
      planetName - The name of the new planet
      parentName - The name of the parent celestial body
      temperature - The planet's temperature in Kelvin
      pressure - The planet's pressure in Pascals
      humidity - The planet's humidity percentage (0-100)
      radiation - The planet's radiation level in Sieverts

    • addSatellite

      public void addSatellite(String satelliteName, String parentName, double temperature, double pressure, double humidity, double radiation)
      Adds a new satellite (moon) to the system under a specified parent.
      Parameters:
      satelliteName - The name of the new satellite
      parentName - The name of the parent celestial body
      temperature - The satellite's temperature in Kelvin
      pressure - The satellite's pressure in Pascals
      humidity - The satellite's humidity percentage (0-100)
      radiation - The satellite's radiation level in Sieverts

    • findRadiationAnomalies

      public void findRadiationAnomalies(double threshold)
      Finds all celestial bodies with radiation levels above the specified threshold.
      Parameters:
      threshold - The radiation threshold in Sieverts

    • getPathTo

      public void getPathTo(String targetName)
      Finds and displays the path from the root to a specified celestial body.
      Parameters:
      targetName - The name of the celestial body to find

    • printMissionReport

      public void printMissionReport()
      Prints a complete mission report for the entire planetary system.

    • printMissionReport

      public void printMissionReport(String nodeName)
      Prints a mission report for a specific celestial body.
      Parameters:
      nodeName - The name of the celestial body to report on
